sen.j: 治承・寿永の乱（じしょう・じゅえいのらん）は、平安時代末期の治承4年（1180年）から元暦2年（1185年）にかけての6年間にわたる大規模な内乱である。
sen.e: Jisho/Juei Rebellion was a large-scale internal rebellion that lasted for six years from 1180 to 1185 during the later Heian Period.
The Jisho/Juei Rebellion was a large-scale internal rebellion that lasted for 6 years from 1180 to 1185 during the later Heian Period.
The Jisho/Juei Rebellion was a large-scale internal rebellion that lasted for 6 years from 1180 to 1185 during the later Heian Period.

sen.j: 後白河天皇の皇子である以仁王による挙兵を契機に各地で平清盛を中心とする六波羅政権ともよばれる平氏政権に対する反乱が起こる。
sen.e: Starting with the raising of forces by Emperor Goshirakawa's prince, Mochihitoo, a country-wide rebellion happened against the Taira clan government, also known as the Rokuhara government, led by TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: 定訳わかりませんが、平氏政権→Taira clan government
sen.e: Starting with the raising of forces by Emperor Goshirakawa's prince, Mochihitoo, a country-wide rebellion against the Taira clan government occurred, also known as the Rokuhara government, which was led by TAIRA no Kiyomori.

Starting with the raising of forces by Emperor Goshirakawa's son, Prince Mochihito, a country-wide rebellion against the Taira clan government occurred, also known as the Rokuhara government, which was led by TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: 以仁王→Prince Mochihitoとしました。princeをsonに訂正しました。

sen.j: 最終的には、反乱勢力同士の対立がありつつも平氏政権の崩壊により源頼朝を中心とした主に坂東平氏から構成される関東政権（鎌倉幕府）の樹立という結果に至る。
sen.e: In the end, although there were divisions among the rebellion forces, the destruction of the Taira clan government led to the establishment of the Kanto government (Kamakura bakufu) mainly consisting of the Bando Taira clan led by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

In the end, although there were divisions among the rebel forces, the destruction of the Taira clan government led to the establishment of the Kanto government (Kamakura bakufu) which mainly consisted of the Bando Taira clan led by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

In the end, although there were divisions among the rebel forces, the destruction of the Taira clan government led to the establishment of the Kanto government (Kamakura bakufu) which mainly consisted of the Bando-Taira clan led by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 一般的には「源平合戦（げんぺいかっせん、げんぺいがっせん）」あるいは「源平の戦い（げんぺいのたたかい）」などの呼称が用いられることがあるが、こうした呼称を用いることは適当でないとする議論がある。
sen.e: Although "Genpei Kassen" or "Genpai no tatakai" (battle between the Taira and Minamoto clans) is conventionally used, there are discussions that consider this term as inappropriate.

Although "Genpei Kassen", "Genpei Gassen', or "Genpai no tatakai" (battle between the Taira and Minamoto clans) is conventionally used, there are discussions that consider these terms as inappropriate.

Although 'Genpei Kassen' (also called as 'Genpei Gassen,' or 'Genpai no tatakai;' the battle between Taira and Minamoto clans) is conventionally used, there are discussions that consider these terms as inappropriate.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。括弧書き訂正しました。

sen.j: 平安時代の末期、皇族・貴族内部の権力闘争が、保元の乱・平治の乱といった軍事衝突に発展するようになった。
sen.e: The power struggle amongst Imperial family members and the aristocracy during the later Heian Period led to military conflicts such as Hogen no ran and Heiji no ran.
The power struggle amongst Imperial family members and the aristocracy during the later Heian Period led to military conflicts such as Hogen no ran and Heiji no ran.
The power struggle amongst Imperial family members and the aristocracy during the later Heian period led to military conflicts such as Hogen Rebellion and Heiji Rebellion.

sen.j: こうした内乱で大きな働きをした平清盛は、武士の身分でありながら異例の栄達を遂げ（平清盛の実父が白河天皇だったためとする説もある）、仁安 (日本)2年（1167年）には太政大臣となる。
sen.e: TAIRA no Kiyomori was highly successful in quelling these rebellions and attained exceptional advancement even if he belonged to the warrior class (there are theories proposing that Emperor Shirakawa was TAIRA no Kiyomori's biological father), reaching the post of Grand Minister of State in 1167.

TAIRA no Kiyomori was highly successful in quelling these rebellions and attained exceptional advancement even though he belonged to the warrior class (there are theories proposing that Emperor Shirakawa was TAIRA no Kiyomori's biological father), reaching the post of Grand Minister of State in 1167.

TAIRA no Kiyomori was highly successful in quelling these rebellions and attained exceptional advancement even though he belonged to the warrior class (there are theories proposing that Emperor Shirakawa was TAIRA no Kiyomori's biological father), reaching the post of Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in 1167.
sen.cmt: スペース削除。太政大臣→Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state)としました。

sen.j: 平氏一門は主要官位を占め、多数の知行国を得て、事実上の平氏政権が成立した。
sen.e: Members of the Taira clan held principal posts and obtained governorship of many provinces, effectively establishing a Taira clan government.
Members of the Taira clan held principal posts and obtained governorship of many provinces, effectively establishing a Taira clan government.
Members of the Taira clan held principal posts and obtained governorship of chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom), effectively establishing a Taira clan government.
sen.cmt: 知行国→chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom)としました。

tit.cmt: 「鹿ケ谷の陰謀」のタイトルファイルに合わせて、Shishigatani Conspiracyとしました。

sen.j: 平清盛一族（平氏）の隆盛は、旧来の勢力である他の貴族や皇族の権益を圧迫した。
sen.e: The prosperity of the TAIRA no Kiyomori's family (Taira clan) intruded upon the interests of other aristocrats and Imperial family members who were part of the old regime.
The prosperity of TAIRA no Kiyomori's family (the Taira clan) intruded upon the interests of other aristocrats and Imperial family members who were part of the old regime.
The prosperity of TAIRA no Kiyomori's family (the Taira clan) intruded upon the interests of other aristocrats and Imperial family members who were part of the old regime.

sen.j: 武士身分出身である平氏への嫌悪も手伝って、貴族層を中心に平清盛政権への反発が密かに広まった。
sen.e: With the help of hatred towards the Taira clan, who originated from the warrior class, rebellion against the TAIRA no Kiyomori's government started to secretly spread among mainly the aristocracy.
With the help of hatred towards the Taira clan, who originated from the warrior class, rebellion against TAIRA no Kiyomori's government started to secretly spread, mainly among the aristocracy.
With the help of hatred towards the Taira clan, who originated from the warrior class, rebellion against TAIRA no Kiyomori's government started to secretly spread, mainly among the aristocracy.

sen.j: これが具体化したものが、安元3年（1177年）の鹿ケ谷の陰謀である。
sen.e: This took a more concrete shape in 1177 as the Shishigatani Plot.
This took a more concrete shape in 1177 as the Shishigatani Plot.
This took a more concrete shape in 1177 as the Shishigatani Conspiracy.
sen.cmt: 「鹿ケ谷の陰謀」タイトルファイルに合わせて、Shishigatani Conspiracyとしました。

sen.j: 陰謀は程なく発覚し、荷担した貴族や武士（多くは後白河法皇の近臣）が追放された。
sen.e: The plot was discovered beforehand and associated aristocracy and warrior class (many of them were close aides of cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa) were exiled.
The plot was discovered beforehand and associated aristocrats and warriors (many of them were close aides of the cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa) were exiled.
The conspiracy was discovered beforehand and associated aristocrats and warriors (many of them were close aides of the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa) were exiled.
sen.cmt: conspiracyに訂正しました。Cloistered大文字にしました。

sen.j: この事件以降、平氏政権と後白河法皇の関係は急速に悪化した。
sen.e: After this incident, the relationship between the Taira clan government and cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa cooled rapidly.
After this incident, the relationship between the Taira clan government and cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa cooled rapidly.

tit.e: The raising of forces by Mochihitoo
The raising of forces by Mochihitoo

tit.cmt: 以仁王→Prince Mochihitoとしました。

sen.j: 治承3年（1179年）11月に平清盛によるクーデターで後白河法皇が幽閉され、翌年2月、高倉天皇が言仁（ときひと）親王に譲位（安徳天皇）。
sen.e: In November 1179, a coup by TAIRA no Kiyomori captured the cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and in February 1180, Emperor Takakura abdicated to Imperial Prince Tokihito (Emperor Antoku).

In November 1179, a coup d'etat by TAIRA no Kiyomori captured the cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and in February 1180, Emperor Takakura abdicated in favour of Imperial Prince Tokihito (Emperor Antoku).

In November 1179, a coup d'etat by TAIRA no Kiyomori captured the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and in February 1180, Emperor Takakura abdicated in favor of Imperial Prince Tokihito (Emperor Antoku).
sen.cmt: Cloistered大文字にしました。favor、米国表記に訂正しました。

sen.j: 平氏政権は盤石の体制を築いていった。
sen.e: The Taira clan government laid the foundation to its governance.
The Taira clan government laid the foundations to its governance.
The Taira clan government laid the foundations to its governance.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）、皇位継承がほぼ絶望となった以仁王が、摂津源氏である源頼政の勧めに応じて、平氏追討・安徳天皇の廃位・新政権の樹立を計画した令旨を発して挙兵する。
sen.e: In 1180, following the recommendation of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu Minamoto clan, Mochihitoo, who had virtually no chance of becoming emperor now, raised forces and issued a call to plan an attack on the Taira clan, abolish Emperor Antoku, and establish a new government.

In 1180, following the recommendation of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu Minamoto clan, Mochihitoo, who had virtually no chance of becoming emperor now, raised forces and issued a call to plan an attack on the Taira clan, abolish Emperor Antoku, and establish a new government.

In 1180, following the recommendation of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Settsu-Genji (Minamoto clan), Prince Mochihito, who had virtually no chance of becoming emperor now, raised forces and issued a call to plan an attack on the Taira clan, abolish Emperor Antoku, and establish a new government.
sen.cmt: Settsu-Genji (Minamoto clan) としました。以仁王→Prince Mochihitoとしました。

sen.j: しかし挙兵直前に企てが発覚したことと併せて期待していた令旨に呼応する挙兵勢力も現れなかった。
sen.e: However, this plan was found out just before the forces were ready and no forces anticipated to support the call appeared.
However, this plan was found out just before the forces were ready and none of the forces that had been anticipated to support the call appeared.
However, this plan was found out just before the forces were ready and none of the forces that had been anticipated to support the call appeared.

sen.j: そして、平知盛・平重衡率いる平氏の大軍によって、同年5月に宇治の平等院で源頼政一族は敗死することになるが、この挙兵が後6年間にわたる内乱の契機となる。
sen.e: Therefore, the large Taira clan troops led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira destroyed MINAMOTO no Yorimasa's family at Byodoin temple in Uji, and this became the start of an internal rebellion that lasted for 6 years.

Therefore, the large force of Taira clan troops led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira destroyed MINAMOTO no Yorimasa's family at Byodoin temple in Uji, and this became the start of an internal rebellion that lasted for 6 years.

Therefore, the large force of Taira clan troops led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira destroyed MINAMOTO no Yorimasa's family at Byodo-in Temple in Uji in May of that year, and this became the start of an internal rebellion that lasted for 6 years.
sen.cmt: in May of that year補足しました。平等院→Byodo-in Temple

The Raising of Forces by the Kanto Bushi Group

sen.j: 以仁王敗死の直後から、以仁王への同調者らによって令旨が各地に雌伏する河内源氏へと伝達された。
sen.e: Immediately after the death of Mochihitoo, Mochihitoo's sympathizers passed on his call to Kawachi Minamoto clan members lying in wait across the country.
Immediately after the death of Mochihitoo, Mochihitoo's sympathizers passed on his call to Kawachi Minamoto clan members lying in wait across the country.
Immediately after the death of Prince Mochihito, his sympathizers passed on his call to Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) members lying in wait across the country.
sen.cmt: 以仁王→Prince Mochihitoとしました。Mochihitoo's→hisと訂正。河内源氏→Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) に訂正しました。

sen.j: そのうちの1人である源頼朝は、6月末頃から河内源氏累代の家人とされる相模・伊豆・武蔵の武士団への呼びかけを始めて、8月17日には、伊豆在住の山木兼隆を襲撃して殺害する。
sen.e: One of them, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, started from towards the end of June to call to bushi groups in Sagami, Izu and Musashi that were traditionally vassals of the Kawachi Minamoto clan, and attacked and killed Kanetaka YAMAKI, who lived in Izu.

One of them, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, from near the end of June started to call to bushi groups in Sagami, Izu and Musashi that were traditionally vassals of the Kawachi Minamoto clan, and attacked and killed Kanetaka YAMAKI, who lived in Izu.

One of them, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, from near the end of June started to call to bushi groups in Sagami, Izu and Musashi that were traditionally vassals of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), and attacked and killed Kanetaka YAMAKI, who lived in Izu, on August 17.
sen.cmt: 河内源氏→Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) に訂正しました。日付を追加しました。

sen.j: その直後、相模国石橋山にて大庭景親らと交戦して頼朝軍は惨敗する（石橋山の戦い）。
sen.e: Immediately after that, Yoritomo troops experience a large loss in a battle against Kagechika Oba at Mt. Ishibashi in Sagami Province (Battle of Mt. Ishibashi).
Immediately after that, Yoritomo's troops experienced a large loss in a battle against Kagechika Oba at Mt. Ishibashi in Sagami Province (the Battle of Mt. Ishibashi).
Immediately after that, Yoritomo's troops experienced a large loss in a battle against Kagechika OBA at Mt. Ishibashi in Sagami Province (the Battle of Mt. Ishibashi).

sen.j: 頼朝は、海路で安房国へ移動して相模三浦半島の豪族である三浦氏と合流した後、安房の在庁官人をはじめ房総半島の上総広常、千葉常胤、武蔵の足立遠元、畠山重忠らの諸豪族を傘下に加えながら急速に大勢力となっていく。
sen.e: Yoritomo took a sea route to Awa Province to join up with the powerful family within the Sagami Miura peninsula, the Miura clan, and gathered various families such as the local officials of Awa Province, Hirotsune KAZUSA and Tsunetane CHIBA of the Boso peninsula, Tomoto ADACHI and Shigetada HATAKEYAMA of Musashi, rapidly becoming a major force.

Yoritomo took a sea route to Awa Province to join up with the powerful family within the Sagami Miura peninsula, the Miura clan, and gathered various families such as the local officials of Awa Province, Hirotsune KAZUSA and Tsunetane CHIBA of the Boso peninsula, Tomoto ADACHI and Shigetada HATAKEYAMA of Musashi, rapidly becoming a major force.

Yoritomo took a sea route to Awa Province to join up with the powerful family within the Sagami Miura peninsula, the Miura clan, and gathered various families such as the local officials of Awa Province, Hirotsune KAZUSA and Tsunetane CHIBA of the Boso peninsula, Tomoto ADACHI and Shigetada HATAKEYAMA of Musashi, rapidly becoming a major force.

sen.j: この勢力の大部分は、関東一帯に勢力をはる平氏系武士であり、在地領主でもあった。
sen.e: The majority of the troops were bushi belonging to the Taira clan associated with the Kanto area and were also the actual local governor.
The majority of the troops were bushi belonging to the Taira clan associated with the Kanto area and were also actually local governors.
The majority of the troops were bushi belonging to the Taira clan associated with the Kanto area and were also in fact local governors.
sen.cmt: actually -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 当時、武士身分の領地所有は不安定であって頼朝軍への急速な武士の集結の背景には、武士による権利確立への強い希求があったのではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: In those times, the ownership of land by members of the warrior class was uncertain and it is suggested that the reason for the rapid gathering of bushi under the Yoritomo troops because there was a strong wish for a government controlled by bushi.

In those times, the ownership of land by members of the warrior class was uncertain and it is suggested that the reason for the rapid gathering of bushi under Yoritomo's troops was because there was a strong wish for a government controlled by bushi.

In those times, the ownership of land by members of the warrior class was uncertain and it is suggested that the reason for the rapid gathering of bushi under Yoritomo's troops was because there was a strong wish for a government controlled by bushi.

sen.j: 10月6日、頼朝は先祖のゆかりの地である相模国鎌倉へ入って本拠地とする。
sen.e: On October 6, Yoritomo entered Kamakura in the Sagami Province, which was a place linked with his ancestry.
On October 6, Yoritomo entered Kamakura in Sagami Province, which was a place linked with his ancestry.

sen.j: これにより関東政権（後の鎌倉幕府）が樹立する。
sen.e: This was the establishment of the Kanto government (later, the Kamakura bakufu).
This was the establishment of the Kanto government (later, the Kamakura bakufu).
This was the establishment of the Kanto government (later, the Kamakura bakufu).

sen.j: また、この時までに関東政権は関東南部の実質的な支配権を獲得している。
sen.e: By this time, the Kanto government had effectively obtained control of Southern Kanto.
By this time, the Kanto government had effectively obtained control of Southern Kanto.
By this time, the Kanto government had effectively obtained control of Southern Kanto.

sen.j: 同時期に、関東では甲斐源氏の武田信義も挙兵していた。
sen.e: At the same time, Nobuyoshi TAKEDA of the Kai Minamoto clan had raised forces in Kanto as well.
At the same time, Nobuyoshi TAKEDA of the Kai Minamoto clan had raised forces in Kanto as well.
At the same time, Nobuyoshi TAKEDA of the Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan) had raised forces in Kanto as well.
sen.cmt: Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan) に訂正しました。

sen.j: 関東での状況を受けて平氏政権は平維盛、平忠度らが率いる追討軍を派遣した。
sen.e: In response to the situation in Kanto, the Taira clan government sent forces led by TAIRA no Koremori and TAIRA no Tadanori.
In response to the situation in Kanto, the Taira clan government sent forces led by TAIRA no Koremori and TAIRA no Tadanori.
In response to the situation in Kanto, the Taira clan government sent forces led by TAIRA no Koremori and TAIRA no Tadanori.

sen.j: 追討軍は東海道を下り、10月18日、駿河国黄瀬川で源頼朝、武田信義の関東連合軍と対峙する。
sen.e: The sent forces traveled by the Tokaido and met the Kanto Allied Forces of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and Nobuyoshi TAKEDA at the Kise River in Suruga Province on October 18.
The forces traveled by the Tokaido and met the Kanto Allied Forces of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and Nobuyoshi TAKEDA at the Kise River in Suruga Province on October 18.
The forces traveled by Tokai-do Road and met the Kanto Allied Forces of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and Nobuyoshi TAKEDA at the Kise-gawa River in Suruga Province on October 18.
sen.cmt: 東海道→Tokai-do Roadとしました。-gawa補足しました。

sen.j: 大軍を見て平氏軍からは脱落者が相次ぎ、目立った交戦もないまま平氏軍は敗走することとなった（富士川の戦い）。
sen.e: Seeing the large force they were against, many defected from the Taira clan troops and the battle ended with no serious engagements and the Taira clan forces fleeing the site (The Battle of Fuji River).

Seeing the large force they faced, many troops defected from the Taira clan forces and the battle ended with no serious engagements and the Taira clan forces fleeing the site (The Battle of Fuji River).

Seeing the large force they faced, many troops defected from the Taira clan forces and the battle ended with no serious engagements and the Taira clan forces fleeing the site (The Battle of Fuji-gawa River).

sen.j: これに乗じて頼朝は上洛も検討するが、関東政権の大勢は東国経営の優先を望んだために鎌倉に帰還した。
sen.e: Yoritomo considered proceeding on to Kyoto with the momentum he had gained, but the majority of the Kanto government wished for priority in managing the East Country so he returned to Kamakura.
Yoritomo considered proceeding on to Kyoto with the momentum he had gained, but the majority of the Kanto government gave priority to managing the East Country so he returned to Kamakura.
Yoritomo considered proceeding on to Kyoto with the momentum he had gained, but the majority of the Kanto government gave priority to managing the East Country so he returned to Kamakura.

sen.j: その後、頼朝は巨大となった武士団を統率するため侍所を新設し、和田義盛を別当、梶原景時を所司に任じる。
sen.e: Later, Yoritomo newly established the Saburai-dokoro (station for Samurai) to manage the large numbers in the Bushi Group and named Yoshimori WADA as Betto (chief of Samurai-dokoro) and Kagetoki KAJIWARA as Shoshi (deputy of Samurai-dokoro).

Later, Yoritomo newly established the Samurai-dokoro (station for Samurai) to manage the large numbers in the Bushi Group and named Yoshimori WADA as Betto (chief of the Samurai-dokoro) and Kagetoki KAJIWARA as Shoshi (deputy of the Samurai-dokoro).

Later, Yoritomo newly established the Samurai-dokoro (station for Samurai) to manage the large numbers in the Bushi Group and named Yoshimori WADA as Betto (chief of the Samurai-dokoro) and Kagetoki KAJIWARA as Shoshi (deputy of the Samurai-dokoro).

sen.j: 当時の関東の武士にとって、最優先事項であったのは関東内部の政治的安定である。
sen.e: For the Kanto bushi at that time, political stability within the Kanto region was top priority.
For the Kanto bushi at that time, political stability within the Kanto region was their top priority.
For the Kanto bushi at that time, political stability within the Kanto region was their top priority.

sen.j: 京都の中央政府への復帰を目指していた頼朝とは目的を異にしていたものと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that their aim was different from that of Yoritomo's, which was to return to the central government in Kyoto.
It is thought that their aim was different from that of Yoritomo's, which was to return to central government in Kyoto.
It is thought that their aim was different from that of Yoritomo's, which was to return to central government in Kyoto.

sen.j: 頼朝には、自らの支持勢力の権利を確保することが求められており、実際に頼朝は、志田義広、新田義重、佐竹氏や足利忠綱といった関東在住の非支持勢力を排除するか、もしくは、屈服させることに非常に尽力している。
sen.e: Yoritomo was asked to maintain the rights for his support force and spent much effort on eliminating or subduing forces based in Kanto that did not support him, such as Yoshihiro SHIDA, oshishige NITTA, the Satake clan and Tadatsuna ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 当初、後白河上皇以下、貴族から庶民まで義仲の入京を歓迎したが、前年の養和の大飢饉の影響により義仲軍を養う食糧が不足して義仲軍は市中で略奪や狼藉を始めたために義仲の評判は落ちて、源頼朝の上洛を願う声が高まっていく。
sen.e: Initially, everyone from the retired Emperor Goshirakawa, aristocrats to the local people welcomed the entry of Yoshinaka into Kyoto but the great famine of Yowa the year led to insufficient food for Yoshinaka's troops, who started to steal and became violent, leading to a drop in Yoshinaka's popularity and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's entry was gradually wished for.

sen.j: 頼朝は、後白河法皇から上洛を催促されたが、鎌倉に留まって逆に法皇へ東海道・東山道・北陸道の国衙領・荘園をもとのように、国司・本所へ返還させる内容の宣旨発布を要請する。
sen.e: Yoritomo was requested by cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa to come to Kyoto, but he stayed in Kamakura and asked the cloistered Emperor to issue an imperial order regarding the return of Kokugaryo (property governed by the local provincial office) and soen (private estates) in Tokaiso, Tosando and Hokurikudo back to the Kokushi and Honjo.

sen.j: その結果、法皇は義仲への配慮のため北陸道は除いたが、ほぼ上記の内容を認める寿永二年十月宣旨を頼朝へ発して東海道・東山道の荘園・国衙領を元の通り領家に従わせる権限（沙汰権）が頼朝に認められた。
sen.e: As a result, the cloistered Emperor issued "Juei Ninen ju gatsu no senji", an Imperial order close to the content above except that Hokurikudo was excluded to honor Yoshinaka and gave Yoritomo the right (Sata ken) to return soen and Kokugaryo in the Tokaido and Tosando back to its owner.

tit.j: 「源平合戦」という呼称について
tit.cmt: 前出の表記に合わせました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 治承・寿永の乱は、源平合戦（または「源平の戦い」）と呼ばれることも多い。
sen.e: Jisho/Juei Rebellion is often called the "Genpei Kassen" (or "Genpai no tatakai" (battle between the Taira and Minamoto clans)).

sen.j: この争乱が以仁王の「平氏追討」の令旨に始まること、平氏政権から頼朝政権（鎌倉幕府）に交代したこと、民間レベルでは『平家物語』や『源平盛衰記』などの影響から清盛・宗盛ら平氏一門と頼朝・義経・義仲ら源氏一門の争いと受け取られてきたことなどが、この呼称を生んだといえる。
sen.e: This term was born because the war was considered as a fight between Kiyomori, Munemori of the Taira family and Yoritomo, Yoshitsune, Yoshinaka of the Minamoto clan due to the fact that the war started with Mochihitoo's call for "destroying the Taira clan", the transition from the Taira clan government to Yoritomo government (Kamkura bakufu), and the effect of stories on the people such as "Heike Monogatari" (The Tales of the Heike) and "Genpei Seisuiki" (The Rise and Fall of the Genji and the Heike),

sen.j: しかし、平氏政権に反旗を翻した勢力は源氏一族のみで構成されていたわけではなく、単純に源氏と平氏の争いとは言えない。

sen.j: また、この争乱は、一族や家族、地域の共同体という横の絆と、主君と家臣という縦の絆の相克があり、命を懸けて戦った武士の全てが源氏や平氏という特定氏族に収斂されるわけでもない。
sen.e: Additionally, this war was a conflict between the ties amongst clan, family and regional community and the ties between lord and vassal, and all of the warriors who fought for their lives could not simply be classified into specific clans such as Minamoto or Taira.

sen.j: 更に、平氏政権も頼朝政権も共に「院政の克服」という歴史的課題を背負い、その中から生じた政権であることなどから、歴史学上はこの呼称は適切とは言えず、年号を付して呼ぶ方が妥当であるとされる。
sen.e: In addition, both the Taira clan government and Yoritomo government had a historic problem, "controlling Insei"(government by cloistered emperors), and were governments that occurred because of this situation, this term is not appropriate historically and it is considered appropriate to add the era/year.
